title: Real-Time Autonomous Surveillance System Operation Simulation for Coastal Accident Prevention

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: VR-based practical training for senior managers/leaders to identify coastal risk factors and strengthen system operation capabilities

learning_goals: Coastal accident risk factors (strong currents, collisions with rocks, underwater organism hazards, etc.) can be identified with 90% accuracy.
Accident prevention decisions can be made within 30 minutes using a real-time autonomous monitoring system.
Response protocols for five or more crisis scenarios can be applied in VR simulations.
Deep learning-based image analysis results can be interpreted to prioritize safety measures.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
